p: A total of 150 one-day-old hatched broiler chickens (Ross 308) were obtained from the local hatchery, AL-Khumasia Feed and Animal Products Company, Riyadh, Saudi Arabia. Birds were then randomized to six treatment groups using a completely randomized design. Each group consisted of 25 birds with five replicates per group and 5 birds per replicate. The starter (1 to 21 d) and finisher (22 to 28 d) diets were provided according to the Ross 308 guideline ( Table 1). Birds were fed with commercial diets at 1, 3, and 5 g RN/kg diet in groups 1, 2, and 3, respectively. Group 4 birds were fed with basal diets plus 66 mg Sacox. The 66 mg Salinomycin/kg diet were used as standard coccidiosis drug supplemented with diet based on previous studies such as [ 12, 13].
